cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles south-southwest of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest then north‐northwest across the Yucatan Channel into the central Gulf, aiming toward the Louisiana coast late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely south-central to southeast Louisiana)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for western Cuba (Artemisa) and Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Pinar del Rio (Cuba) and Tulum to Rio Lagartos (Yucatan); Tropical-Storm Warning for Cayman Islands and Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, and the northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama, including all of Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) increasingly likely late Thursday night into Friday with a 25 % chance of 50-kt (hurricane-force gusts possible).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–6 ft above ground along southeast Louisiana tidal waterways and the lower Mississippi River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk along the river corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; reduced visibility and river current surges affecting vessel mooring and cargo operations.
